availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, physician. Maryland native. Son of George Thum. Married to Louisa Miller Thum in Louisville on November 16, 1852. Father of William Warwick Thum. Graduate of Gambia College in Ohio. Studied medicine in Richmond, Virginia and Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. Physician in Louisville in 1850.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, District 2, p. 152B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Jefferson County Marriages, Film #000482707, p. 23.
Find A Grave, "Dr. Mandeville Thum (December 20, 1820-March 16, 1862)," Memorial #11800548, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/11800548 (accessed September 26, 2018).
Paul Brandon Barringer and James Mercer eds. University of Virginia: Its History, Influence, Equipment and Characteristics (New York: Lewis Publishing Company, 1904), 138.
